intro: Baeckea uncinella, commonly known as the hooked baeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters, typically in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a glossy green surface. Baeckea uncinella is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
